org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket

Class WebSocketMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.WebSocketMessage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WebSocketProxyV13.WebSocketMessageV13

    public abstract class WebSocketMessage
extends Object
    Represents a single WebSocket message, consisting of at least one frame.

    This class was created with sight on the WebSocketMessage class of the Monsoon project, although it is not based on Java's NIO features.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  WebSocketMessage.Direction
      Orientation of WebSocket message.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int closeCode
      Indicates the status code of this message if it is a close message.
      protected WebSocketMessage.Direction direction
      Determined after first frame is processed.
      protected boolean isFinished
      Indicates if this message already contains all of its frames.
      protected int opcode
      Indicates the opcode of this message.
      static int OPCODE_BINARY 
      static int OPCODE_CLOSE 
      static int OPCODE_CONTINUATION
      Either continuation for OPCODE_TEXT or OPCODE_BINARY.
      static int OPCODE_PING 
      static int OPCODE_PONG 
      static int OPCODE_TEXT 
      static int[] OPCODES 
      protected ByteBuffer payload
      This buffer will contain the whole payload, unmasked
      static int STATUS_CODE_EXTENSION_NEGOTIATION_FAILED
      Indicates that an endpoint (client) is terminating the connection because it has expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server didn't return them in the response message of the WebSocket handshake.
      static int STATUS_CODE_GOING_AWAY
      Indicates that an endpoint is "going away", such as a server going down or a browser having navigated away from a page.
      static int STATUS_CODE_INVALID_DATA
      Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received data within a message that was not consistent with the type of the message (e.g., non-UTF-8 [RFC3629] data within a text message).
      static int STATUS_CODE_INVALID_DATA_TYPE
      Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a type of data it cannot accept (e.g., an endpoint that understands only text data MAY send this if it receives a binary message).
      static int STATUS_CODE_MESSAGE_TOO_LARGE
      Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big for it to process.
      static int STATUS_CODE_OK
      Indicates a normal closure, meaning that the purpose for which the connection was established has been fulfilled.
      static int STATUS_CODE_POLICY_VIOLATION
      Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that violates its policy.
      static int STATUS_CODE_PROTOCOL_ERROR
      Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection due to a protocol error.
      static int STATUS_CODE_SERVER_ERROR
      Indicates that a server is terminating the connection because it encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.
      protected Timestamp timestamp
      Indicating when this message was received.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_CODE_INVALID_DATA

        public static final int STATUS_CODE_INVALID_DATA
        Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received data within a message that was not consistent with the type of the message (e.g., non-UTF-8 [RFC3629] data within a text message).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_CODE_POLICY_VIOLATION

        public static final int STATUS_CODE_POLICY_VIOLATION
        Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that violates its policy. This is a generic status code that can be returned when there is no other more suitable status code (e.g., 1003 or 1009) or if there is a need to hide specific details about the policy.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_CODE_MESSAGE_TOO_LARGE

        public static final int STATUS_CODE_MESSAGE_TOO_LARGE
        Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big for it to process.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_CODE_EXTENSION_NEGOTIATION_FAILED

        public static final int STATUS_CODE_EXTENSION_NEGOTIATION_FAILED
        Indicates that an endpoint (client) is terminating the connection because it has expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server didn't return them in the response message of the WebSocket handshake. The list of extensions that are needed SHOULD appear in the "reason" part of the Close frame. Note that this status code is not used by the server, because it can fail the WebSocket handshake instead.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_CODE_SERVER_ERROR

        public static final int STATUS_CODE_SERVER_ERROR
        Indicates that a server is terminating the connection because it encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPCODES

        public static final int[] OPCODES

      • opcode

        protected int opcode
        Indicates the opcode of this message. Initially it is set to -1, meaning that its type is unknown.

      • closeCode

        protected int closeCode
        Indicates the status code of this message if it is a close message. Initially it is set to -1, meaning that its close code is unknown.

      • getCloseCode

        public int getCloseCode()
        Returns the status code if the message's opcode is a OPCODE_CLOSE. One of the possible close codes is STATUS_CODE_OK.
        Returns:

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Returns true if all frames for this message were already read (i.e.: if the frame with the FIN flag was read).
        Returns:
        True if all frames were received.

      • appendPayload

        protected void appendPayload(byte[] bytes)
        Use this helper for concatenating payloads of different WebSocket frames. Flips the payload buffer as soon as this message is finished.

        newSize - size in bytes for the resized buffer

        public Timestamp getTimestamp()
        Returns date of receiving this message. Might also indicate the timestamp of the last frame received.
        Returns:
        timestamp of message arrival

      • getPayloadLength

        public abstract Integer getPayloadLength()
        Returns:
        number of bytes used in the payload

      • getPayload

        public abstract byte[] getPayload()
        Returns the 'original' payload as found in the WebSocket frame. Returned bytes array does not back the messages payload buffer (i.e. it is a copy).
        Returns:
        bytes of payload

      • setPayload

        public abstract void setPayload(byte[] newPayload)
                         throws WebSocketException
        Modifies the payload to given byte array. Use setReadablePayload(String) for setting payloads of non-binary messages.
        Parameters:
        newPayload -
        Throws:
        WebSocketException

      • getReadablePayload

        public abstract String getReadablePayload()
        Returns the payload from getPayload() as readable string (i.e.: converted to UTF-8).
        Returns:
        readable representation of payload

      • setReadablePayload

        public abstract void setReadablePayload(String newReadablePayload)
                                 throws WebSocketException
        Modifies the payload to given UTF-8 string. Converts that into bytes.
        Parameters:
        newReadablePayload -
        Throws:
        WebSocketException

      • getDirection

        public abstract WebSocketMessage.Direction getDirection()
        Returns either WebSocketMessage.Direction.INCOMING if this message originated from server side, or WebSocketMessage.Direction.OUTGOING if it came from the browser.
        Returns:
        message flow indicator
